channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: Every Australian will receive a free dose of a coronavirus vaccine if trials prove successful under a deal procured by the federal government.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Victoria records 216 new COVID-19 cases as free Oxford vaccine deal sealed by Morrison government; Australian death toll jumps to 450

item.description: They will form part of a new environment bill introduced last year and will force the current and future governments to focus on climate change improvements.
item.title: British governments to be legally bound by new environmental targets

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: Essendon are contemplating including goalkicker Jake Stringer for their crucial match against Richmond in Darwin.
item.title: Stringer a chance to return for Bombers

item.dc:creator: Jennifer Duke
item.description: Some of Australia's most powerful unions have enterprise agreements that give workers more take home pay if the minimum superannuation rise does not go through.
item.title: 'Clear trade-off': Unions are prepared for no rise in compulsory super

item.dc:creator: Anne Summers
item.description: Australians trapped on foreign soil, desperate to return home, are confronted with Australia's new tight entry limits and airlines gouging them for as much as $20,000 to fly from the United States.
item.title: Can we still call Australia home? The refrain of expats facing shut borders and $20k flights

item.description: "After 15 years and a Special Tribunal for Lebanon with international investigators, and we end up with this?"
item.title: Muted end to Hariri murder trial raises doubts for Beirut blast probe

item.dc:creator: Farrah Tomazin
item.description: An unprecedented Democratic National Convention continues, as party luminaries and citizens line up to challenge US President Donald Trump on the direction of the country.
item.title: US election 2020 LIVE updates: Bill Clinton rebukes Trump at DNC; Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, Joe Biden's wife to speak

item.dc:creator: Stephen Bartholomeusz
item.description: After plunging 34 per cent between mid-February and late March, the US sharemarket has since soared more than 50 per cent.
item.title: Wall St's short, sharp shock bear market suddenly ends - in curious circumstances

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: Premier Gladys Berejklian says it is a miracle that only one security guard involved in hotel quarantine in NSW had contracted COVID-19.
item.title: Premier defends infected hotel quarantine worker as state records seven new cases

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: The owner of fire-ravaged Brisbane hotel has submitted new plans to preserve it. However, he has asked to demolish a WWII air-raid shelter at the rear.
item.title: Air-raid shelter to go in scaled-back plans lodged for Broadway Hotel

item.dc:creator: Dana McCauley
item.description: Trials of the vaccine candidate and manufacturing agreements were "well advanced", Scott Morrison said on Wednesday.
item.title: PM says Oxford vaccine deal for COVID-19 offers hope

item.dc:creator: Simon Johanson
item.description: Australia’s second largest mall landlord announces $1.8b full-year loss as social distancing measures to contain the pandemic eat into its rental income and property values.
item.title: Store closures, fall in values push mall giant Vicinity to $1.8b loss

item.dc:creator: Jewel Topsfield
item.description: The federal regulator took action against an aged care facility linked to 100 coronavirus cases after finding immediate and severe risks to residents.
item.title: Regulator found 'severe risk' to residents' safety at Sunbury nursing home

item.description: Follow news and events as they happen.
item.title: Tablet interactive: US presidential election 2020

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: Queensland has the potential to become a renewable energy superpower, creating more than 5200 construction jobs in renewable energy projects over 15 years.
item.title: How Queensland could become a renewable energy superpower

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: Queensland Opposition Leader Deb Frecklington makes an embarrassing gaffe during an economic announcement on Wednesday.
item.title: 'It is a male and his name escapes me': Qld LNP leader's blunder

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: The site, sold to developers by the federal government in 2009, is back on the market and politicians are keen to see it in public hands.
item.title: Fresh calls for council to purchase former ABC Toowong site

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: League officials have refrained from speaking about whether Kevin Proctor should have been sent off. Now they've had their say.
item.title: 'No alternative': NRL insists referee was right to send off biter

item.dc:creator: Craig Mathieson
item.description: Wrenching and empathetic, Liz Garbus' six-part HBO documentary I’ll Be Gone in the Dark is what the genre needs.
item.title: Finally, a true-crime doco that doesn't turn victims to chalk outlines

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: While Queensland has not detected any locally acquired COVID-19 cases in more than two weeks, there are no plans to allow dancing in public, Premier says.
item.title: 'If people want to dance, they should do it at home': Restrictions to stay

item.dc:creator: Emma Koehn
item.description: The local biotech giant's CEO says there are still major questions that need to be answered on the way to a successful COVID-19 vaccine.
item.title: 'Be prepared for anything': CSL boss warns of key unknowns on vaccine

item.dc:creator: Michael Lynch
item.description: Supercars has struck a five-year deal with leading car parts maker Repco to back the Bathurst 1000, in a deal being hailed as a major endorsement for the sport.
item.title: Supercars nail down five-year Bathurst sponsorship deal

item.dc:creator: Farrah Tomazin
item.description: The decision comes after a number of states had indicated that they would file lawsuits against the Postal Service and DeJoy in a bid to reverse his changes.
item.title: US Postal Service cost-cutting measures shelved until after election

item.description: France and the UN fear the deepening crisis will destabilise West Africa's Sahel, a region already marred by jihadist insurgence.
item.title: Mutinying soldiers force Mali President's resignation

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: USQ researcher Dr Rajib Rana has developed AI that can detect whether someone is faking an emergency call, which will be trialled in a Metro North hotline.
item.title: AI that can detect hoax calls put through its paces in new trial

item.dc:creator: Tim Biggs
item.description: Google's latest cut-price Pixel changes the game for budget handsets again, with a spectacular camera and a new modern look.
item.title: Google's Pixel 4a is all the smartphone you need, for $600

item.description: It was a largely red, white and blue evening capped off by a delicate necklace with four letters strung out on a gold chain, like four bated breaths: V-O-T-E.
item.title: Michelle Obama had an urgent message. Her necklace spelled it out

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: Crown Resorts' net profit has tumbled to $79.5 million after the coronavirus pandemic forced the James Packer-backed casino giant to shut its gaming floors.
item.title: Crown Resorts profit slumps 80% on COVID-19 closures

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: AMP says it will release the investigation into the sexual harassment case against AMP Capital chief executive Boe Pahari.
item.title: AMP to release sexual harassment report, stands by execs

item.dc:creator: Rachael Dexter
item.description: Victoria recorded 216 new cases of coronavirus on Wednesday - the fourth consecutive day of numbers below 300.
item.title: 'A good sign': Victoria records 216 new COVID-19 cases

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, August 19, 2020

item.dc:creator: Colin Kruger
item.description: The logistics software maker warns its revenue growth could slow this year as COVID-19 hits global trade, but the pandemic will drive the need for companies to digitise their operations.
item.title: Wisetech sees long-term tailwinds from COVID despite short-term clouds

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: The Tigers fullback has opened up on the reason for his emotional breakdown on the field as he prepares to meet his cousin at NRL level for the first time.
item.title: Why one of the first phone calls to Doueihi came from a Roosters coach

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: Tabcorp will tap investors through an equity raising to pay down debt and strengthen its balance sheet after the gambling giant slumped to a $870 million annual loss.
item.title: Tabcorp in $600m equity raising after COVID-19 inflicts heavy loss

item.description: Follow news and events as they happen.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.description: The Bucks came into the post-season as favourites to win a first title since 1971 but their sluggish play since the NBA resumption continued against the magic.
item.title: Magic upset top-seeded Bucks, Rockets and Heat win in NBA play-offs

item.dc:creator: Darren Gray
item.description: The car classifieds group has reported a 9 per cent fall in its statutory net profit largely due to the impacts of COVID-19, but has maintained its dividend
item.title: Carsales.com profit hit by pandemic but maintains dividend

item.dc:creator: Emma Koehn
item.description: Revenue was up 9 per cent in the biotech giant's blood plasma business and 11 per cent in its flu shot division.
item.title: CSL books $US2b profit despite 'sobering' COVID conditions

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: Higher costs incurred for in-store cleaning and supporting struggling franchisees has led pizza giant Domino's to report a weaker-than-expected full-year result.
item.title: Coronavirus costs weigh on Domino's Pizza as local profits drop

item.dc:creator: James Polson
item.description: The young Sydney Swan banned for the rest of the season for a COVID-19 breach has spoken out against racist messages he has received on social media.
item.title: Swans youngster Taylor racially abused after protocol breach

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: ANZ Bank will pay investors a dividend, as the bank took an extra $500m in provisions for bad loans and warned the coronavirus crisis had a long way to run.
item.title: ANZ pays 25¢ dividend, CEO warns virus crisis 'has a way to go'

item.description: Everything you need to know to pick a winner on a seven-race card.
item.title: Race-by-race tips and preview for Canterbury on Wednesday

item.dc:creator: Scott Spits
item.description: The US Open may suffer another blow after two-time major winner Garbine Muguruza withdrew from a lead-up event with injury.
item.title: Muguruza injury worry, 'non-player' tests positive to COVID-19 ahead of US Open

item.dc:creator: Alex Druce
item.description: The ASX200 is up 0.9% after the S&P 500 and NASDAQ set new record highs overnight and earnings figures continue to impress
item.title: ASX near 11-week highs on earnings glow; Big gains for CSL, Wisetech

item.description: The French club, celebrating the 50th anniversary of their founding in 1970, will meet the winner of the other semi between Bayern Munich and Lyon.
item.title: PSG do it easy against Leipzig to make first Champions League final

item.dc:creator: Nathan Hondros
item.description: The WA government has rebuffed calls for an independent review of the risks posed by the 7000 people who have entered the state with quarantine exemptions since the 'hard border' restrictions were put in place in early April.
item.title: WA government rejects calls for a review of 7000 'hard border' quarantine exemptions

item.dc:creator: Marta Pascual Juanola
item.description: Tom Oliver is any manager's dream employee: he is extremely polite, always on time, and has a gift for routine. But he has experienced more discrimination than most.
item.title: 'The stigma contaminates the workplace': Perth man's personal mission to help others with autism

item.dc:creator: Aja Styles
item.description: Aussie tourists in Bali face being caught in a complex web of Indonesian bureaucracy or pay skyrocketing costs to come home in what Perth's Indonesian Institute calls a case of 'checkmate'.
item.title: 'Checkmate': Stranded Australians tackle Bali's murky visa system since they can't afford to come home

item.dc:creator: Jewel Topsfield
item.description: A family who lost their father to COVID-19 faces an agonising wait to see if their mother, who is at the same aged care centre, will also test positive.
item.title: Family faces agonising wait over Sunbury nursing home COVID outbreak

item.description: The event is a much-needed bit of good news for the National Zoo, which had to close for months because of the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: 'A good day': giant panda's pregnancy brings cheer to US National Zoo
